wikipedia_page.main: Richard Howitt (1799–1869) was a British poet.

response: *(1795–1869) Richard Howitt, Heanor-born poet, spent much of his life in Nottingham and died at Edingley.
* Richard Howitt (politician) (born 1961), British politician and CEO

The newspaper provided a showcase for early Australian literature. Local writers who were first published in its pages include Henry Halloran, Charles Harpur and Richard Howitt.Wilde et al., p. 48. Many readers also first became aware of the books of British authors, such as Charles Dickens, when they were discussed in the pages of The Australian.

The family first lived in tents that they had brought from England and then a small hut. In April 1840, the English poet Richard Howitt found himself, with two companions, stranded on the beach after missing the boat which was to take them back to their ship.
